intro: Anagallis linifolia f. rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The variety rubriflora is distinguished by its deep red petals, which contrast with the pale green sepals. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. This plant is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
